CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ).

Let's think step by step.

1. w/w: weight/weight ratio (not a material name, but a measurement)
2. 1 : 4: Ratio of 1 part of the material A to 4 parts of material B
3. photoactive layer: not a specific material name, but a functional description
4. J SC: Short-circuit current density, a material property
5. mA / cm^2 : Milliamperes per square centimeter, a unit of current density
6. V OC: Open-circuit voltage, a material property
7. V: Volt, a unit of voltage
8. FF: Fill factor, a material property
9. PCE: Power conversion efficiency, a material property
10. 4.12%: A percentage value representing the improved power conversion efficiency
11. PCDTBT: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate) (PEDOT:PSS) or Poly(3,4-dithiophene-co-p-phenylene vinylene) (PDTBT), material names
12. PC71BM: Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-p-phenylene vinylene) (P3HT:PCBM), material name.

So, the material names in the paragraph are PCDTBT, PC71BM, and the unspecified material forming the 1 : 4 blend with PCDTBT.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PCDTBT
2. PC71BM
3. The material forming the 1 : 4 blend with PCDTBT.

These are the material names mentioned in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDTBT |
| PC71BM |
| The material forming the 1 : 4 blend with PCDTBT. |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ).

Let's think step by step.

1. w/w blend: This is a ratio or proportion of two components in a mixture, in this case, a 1 : 4 ratio. It is not a property name, but rather a description of the composition of the photoactive layer.
2. J SC: This stands for Short Circuit Current Density, which is a measure of the maximum current that a photovoltaic device can generate under short circuit conditions. It is a property name.
3. V OC: This stands for Open Circuit Voltage, which is the voltage at which a photovoltaic device generates no current under open circuit conditions. It is a property name.
4. FF: This stands for Fill Factor, which is a measure of the efficiency of a photovoltaic device in converting solar energy into electrical energy. It is a property name.
5. PCE: This stands for Power Conversion Efficiency, which is the ratio of the electrical power output of a photovoltaic device to the power of the incident light. It is a property name.
6. PCDTBT: This is a specific material or blend used as a reference in the comparison. It is not a property name.
7. PC71BM: This is another specific material or blend used as a reference in the comparison. It is not a property name.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. J SC: This stands for Short Circuit Current Density, which is a material property that measures the maximum current that a photovoltaic material or device can generate under short circuit conditions.
2. V OC: This stands for Open Circuit Voltage, which is a material property that measures the voltage at which a photovoltaic material or device generates no current under open circuit conditions.
3. FF: This stands for Fill Factor, which is a material property that measures the efficiency of a photovoltaic material or device in converting solar energy into electrical energy.
4. PCE: This stands for Power Conversion Efficiency, which is a material property that measures the ratio of the electrical power output of a photovoltaic material or device to the power of the incident light.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Short Circuit Current Density (J SC) |
| Open Circuit Voltage (V OC) |
| Fill Factor (FF) |
| Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The device containing the 1 : 4 w / w blend as the photoactive layer after thermal annealing at 150 °C delivers at superior performance with the J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , V OC of 0.79 V , and FF of 45% , improving the PCE to 4.12% , an approximately 37% enhance - ment in PCE , when compared to the reference cell based on PCDTBT : PC71BM for the sake of comparison ( see SI ).

Let's think step by step.

1. 1 : 4 w / w blend: This is a ratio of two materials in a weight percentage basis, so it is not a Property Value entity.
2. J SC (Joint Solar Cell): It is a property value representing the current density (in mA/cm^2) at which the solar cell delivers the maximum power.
3. 11.7 mA / cm^2: This is a specific value of J SC.
4. V OC (Open Circuit Voltage): It is a property value representing the voltage (in volts) at which the solar cell delivers no load.
5. 0.79 V: This is a specific value of V OC.
6. FF (Fill Factor): It is a property value representing the ratio of the maximum power output of a solar cell to the product of its open-circuit voltage and short-circuit current.
7. 45%: This is a specific value of FF.
8. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency): It is a property value representing the percentage of the incident solar energy that is converted into electrical energy by the solar cell.
9. 4.12%: This is a specific value of PCE.
10. 37%: This is a percentage representing the enhancement in PCE.
11. PCDTBT : PC71BM: These are the materials used in the reference cell. They are not property values, but rather entities that can be used to compare the performance of the device in the paragraph to the reference cell.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. J SC: 11.7 mA / cm^2
2. V OC: 0.79 V
3. FF: 45%
4. PCE: 4.12%
5. Enhancement in PCE: 37%

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| J SC: 11.7 mA / cm^2 |
| V OC: 0.79 V |
| FF: 45% |
| PCE: 4.12% |
| Enhancement in PCE: 37% |
